title: Game Of Thrones star Kit Harington jokingly says Sophie Turner 'needs to shush'
text:
They appeared together on all eight seasons of Game Of Thrones.

But Kit Harington hit back at his co-star Sophie Turner as he said she 'needs to just shush' sometimes, during an appearance at ACE Comic Con Midwest on Sunday in Chicago, Illinois.

When the actor, 32, was asked about how the 23-year-old actress revealed she would tease him over how long he spent spend getting his hair and make-up done, he jokingly said: 'Sophie Turner needs to just shush every now and then.'

Candid: Game Of Thrones star Kit Harington jokingly said Sophie Turner 'needs to shush' and stop spilling secrets about his time on the show, at ACE Comic Con Midwest on Sunday

Going on to discuss their close bond he added: 'I love that girl to my very bones - the thing about Sophie, Maisie, Isaac and me is that we were together for so long.

'Richard [Madden] was definitely in that too. We became like actual siblings, we would literally fight each other. We have a very sibling relationship.'

The final season of Game Of Thrones aired in May, and was blasted by fans after they complained the series went out on a low with its controversial storyline.

By the end, Kit's character Jon Snow was banished beyond the Wall, while Sophie's Sansa Stark became Queen of the North after the region seceded from the Seven Kingdoms when her brother Bran took over the Iron Throne.

Groomed: The actor made the brazen remark when he was asked about how Sophie revealed she would tease him over how long he spent spend getting his hair and make-up done

Like siblings: However, going on to discuss their close bond he added: 'I love that girl to my very bones - the thing about Sophie, Maisie, Isaac and me is that we were together for so long'

Speaking at the Emmys in September, Kit revealed to Entertainment Weekly that he hasn't watched the show's final season amid fan backlash, as he said: 'I still haven't seen the show so that's how I dealt with that controversy.

'I haven't seen the final season but I know what it took to shoot it and it was hard and everyone put their love and effort into it.

'I think for us, we knew what we were doing was right, story-wise and we knew that it was right for the characters because we lived with them for 10 years so controversy for us didn't really affect us.'

After his eight-year stint on Game of Thrones, Harington is returning to the big screen with a role in the new Marvel Studios movie Eternals.

Filming started in August on Eternals, where Harington stars alongside Angelina Jolie, Salma Hayek, Kumail Nanjiani, Gemma Chan and his Game of Thrones co-star Richard Madden.

Chloe Zhao (The Rider) directs Eternals, which has been given a November 6, 2020 release date.
